cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.AI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with machine learning and computational complexity, which are both broad areas of computer science. The use of local queries in learning is a topic that falls under the category of machine learning, specifically in the area of query-based learning. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with the boolean cube and various classes of functions, which are topics that fall under the category of computational complexity. Therefore, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the limitations of local queries in learning certain classes of functions, which is a topic that falls under the category of artificial intelligence. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper also discusses the use of local queries in information theory, which is a topic that falls under the category of information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is another likely sub-category.
